What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: msa and a little moroccan arabic

I learned a significant vocabulary in a wide-range wide of topics along with any Arabic grammar concepts. I also developed my speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills as a result of this course.
I learned new grammar, vocabulary, and communication skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
cool trips
lots arranged for
inefficiently organized
didn't complete syllabus
This course could have been organized better in order to complete the requirements. We spent too long on the first 3 units and subsequently were unable to complete the remaining 2 units.
Classes were not always well structured. Time could have been used more efficiently and vocabulary employed more intentionally for better retention.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I definitely would recommend this course to a Yale student eager to learn Arabic.
Yes, because taking arabic over the summer is a great way to focus and improve
